title.narrative: Formation à la communication sur la recherche pour des essais de prévention du VIH
Research Communication Training for HIV Prevention Trials

description.narrative:
This project will provide training to members of the HIV/AIDS Prevention Trials Capacity Building Grants Phase 2 program in research communication. This will develop their skills and increase the impact of their work.
About the HIV/AIDS prevention trials program The HIV/AIDS Prevention Trials Capacity Building Grants Phase 2 program aims to: -create sustainable African capacity and leadership to conduct future HIV/AIDS prevention trials -focus on innovations in HIV/AIDS prevention technologies, particularly HIV vaccines -advance collaboration among African, Canadian, and international researchers and institutions in global HIV/AIDS prevention trials efforts
Grant recipients have asked for training in research communication. The Training Centre in Communication, based in Nairobi, Kenya, has proposed a four-day research communication course to support the program's capacity building activities.
The funds will also be used to organize regional training for targeted audiences, including logistics and transportation specialists.
Training, based on an initial needs assessment, will include: -Science communications concepts -Producing policy briefs -Marketing policy briefs -Writing newsletters -Introduction to infographics -Use of Web 2.0 tools for communicating research -Media training
